TopicTitle: What songs do you listen to?

Articles.Content:
I usually listen to the songs you find on the 3DS version of smash, and my own personal mix of my favorite songs.

Please share your songs!
...well, my music library is ~150GB, how do i start to answer that?

...well, my music library is ~150GB, how do i start to answer that?

Like, your favorite songs, I guess.
anything in the background music of games or videos

stuff like this

or this
I find that a lot of the more mellow DeadMau5 songs work quite wonderfully with KSP. Try putting on "Strobe" and cruising through space

I normally don't listen to electronic music, because I think it sounds all the same (dubstep excluded).

LIST:

Rock

Soundtrack

Dubstep

Some electronic

Country

And other stuff I like.

I don't listen to music as much as I used to. Used to always have it on in the car, but I no longer have a car. Generally I go for classic rock & roll & heavy metal. I'd regard AC/DC, Thin Lizzy, Led Zeppelin & Deep Purple as my top 4 favourite bands.

And for the avoidance of doubt, this is the single best vocals performance by any musician:

Metal

Death Metal

Old Metal

Some old Indie music

Grunge

Alternative

Touch of classical

Splash of old school gangsta rap (NWA,Mac 10, etc)

I don't have any one favorite song, I just love music.

I don't listen to much music because I don't have time, and find it boring, but I like classic rock, 1960's and 1980's music, and a few bits of modern music (most is bad, though ).

"Take On Me" and "Everybody Wants To Rule The World" are some of my favorites. As for bands, I really like Bruce Springsteen, U2, the Rolling Stones, the Beatles, and others.

I'm the lead singer of a Rock band, so many things rounding that are a part of my list. Guns N Roses, Queen, Europe, Avenged Sevenfold, AC/DC, etc. You know the drill, there's hundreds of them.

I'm also the concert master of two symphony and one chamber orchestras, so classical music is pretty high up that list. I like both classic and contemporary works. Tchaikovsky, Bach, Haydn, Mozart, Beethoven... Again, there's literally thousands of these dudes.

There's also some groups that sing "alternative" stuff that I like. One

Apart from that, there's little gems in today's music, like "Let Her Go", " Counting Stars", "Paradise"... I don't listen to them much, though.

I have wide musical taste to say the least, my music library is over a terabyte.

But If I list most of my favourite tracks they would mostly be drum and bass / ragga jungle
I'll listen to pretty much anything, but I particularly enjoy old school rap.
